quotes.quote: Being slim is the new elitism. Thinness today says that you are richer, smarter and more successful than the overweight masses.
My advice if you insist on slimming: Eat as much as you like — just don't swallow it.
Even overweight cats instinctively know the cardinal rule: when fat, arrange yourself in slim poses.
Skeletons of mice are often to be found in coconuts, for it is easier to get in, slim and greedy, than to get out, appeased but fat.
Some people can eat anything they want and stay slim. I put on weight just by reading the recipe.

Slim, a term to be used only when you want to judge the chances of you getting away from the onset of feminism; not her figure. Fat, a term to be used only when you want to discuss the nutrition content; not to bully another.
I don't have slim children. I have hearty ones.
I know I don't look like the skinny slender model. I know I look a little different but people like to watch me for some reason. It feels good and I'm humbled by it.

She ran her hands over her body as if to bid it good-bye. The hipbones rising from a shrunken stomach were razor-sharp. Would they be lost in a sea of fat? She counted her ribs bone by bone. Where would they go?
The media made the masses to find not-so-skinny women appear not-so-beautiful … in the eyes of the remote holder.
Many of us are tethered to bodies that sabotage us in our struggle to keep from getting fat, or to slim down when we do.
How come “fat chance” and “slim chance” mean the same thing?
Soon I'll be thinner than all of you, she swore to herself. And then I'll be the winner. The thinner is the winner.
